title: The Effect of a Performing Arts Intervention on People With Dementia and Their Caregivers
description_brief: This study will examine whether a performing arts class will improve the well-being of primary unpaid caregivers of people with dementia
description_detailed: This study used sample size analysis to determine the adequately sized intervention group and control group, well-defined statistical methodology, and a well-documented intervention that can be easily replicated. The intervention has been developed by Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts leadership with assistance from AMS Planning \& Research.
explanation_target: Reason: The described trial is a psychosocial/behavioral intervention — a performing arts class for unpaid caregivers and their people-with-dementia dyads — intended to improve caregiver well-being and quality of life rather than to modify Alzheimer’s biology or test a drug. This is non-pharmacological and does not involve a biologic or small-molecule therapeutic, cognitive-enhancing drug, or a medication for neuropsychiatric symptoms. citeturn0search7turn0search0
